page.title: 04Banwell Museum
page.content: On 31st May 1980 Banwell's first museum was opened by the Banwell Society of Archaeology. It was in a small rented cottage in Church Street. It had only two rooms, a small kitchen and some space on the landing. Exhibits dated from the Iron Age (flints and pottery from the hill forts), the Romans (coins, jewellry and a mosaic from the villas at Winthill and Riverside),the Middle Ages, and from the last two hundred years. There were displays about the mills, the pond, farming, military uniforms and the fire brigade. The 1983 Easter exhibition was the last time the museum opened as the building was sold. It is hoped that in 1986 a new museum display will be seen in Banwell Fire Station, organised by the Friends of Banwell Fire Station and Museum.
